articles.image_title: Head of Emperor Augustus from a colossal bronze statue, an example of the highly skilled workmanship characteristic of Greek craftsmen. The head was found at Meroe in the Sudan; it had probably been taken as booty in an Ethiopian raid on Roman Egypt. Country of Origin: Italy. Culture: Roman. Date/Period: 27-25 BC. Place of Origin: Meroe, Sudan H:47.75cm. Material Size: Bronze with marble & glass eyes. Credit Line: Werner Forman Archive/ British Museum, London . Location: 09.
